Class SineString

java.lang.Object
  SineString
All Implemented Interfaces:
InstrumentString
public class SineString
extends Object
implements InstrumentString

A SineString object simulates a string that resonates as a sine wave at a particular frequency.

Version:
Canonical Solution

Field Summary
static double ENERGY_DECAY_FACTOR
           
 
Constructor Summary
SineString(double frequency)
          Constructs a sine-wave string with a specified frequency.
SineString(double[] init)
          Constructs a sine string with ring buffer initialized to values from the parameter.
 
Method Summary
 void pluck()
          Fills the ring buffer with sine wave samples.
 double sample()
          Access the current sample.
 void tic()
          Advance simulation one step by rotating values in the ring buffer and applying the energy decay factor to the new last sample.
 int time()
          Access the time state of the simulation.

public static final double ENERGY_DECAY_FACTOR
See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

SineString

public SineString(double frequency)
Constructs a sine-wave string with a specified frequency. Preconditions: frequency > 0; frequency <= 2/3 * (sample rate)

Parameters:
frequency - the frequency for this sine string
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if preconditions are not met

SineString

public SineString(double[] init)
Constructs a sine string with ring buffer initialized to values from the parameter. (Used for testing.) Preconditions: init array contains at least 2 values init array values all lie between -0.5 and +0.5

Parameters:
init - initial values for this sine string's ring buffer
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if preconditions are not met
